title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
CVS and Walgreens agreed to pay over $10 billion in a settlement to resolve opioid-crisis lawsuits brought by states, cities and other governments.

Musk said Twitter won't let anyone who was removed from the service for violating its rules back on the platform until the company has a clear process in place.

The SEC said it obtained record monetary sanctions in the latest fiscal year, and the agency advanced two more regulatory initiatives.

Boeing executives laid out plans to restore the plane maker's financial strength over the next three years, following a string of losses.

Penguin Random House wants to appeal a decision blocking its acquisition of Simon & Schuster, but the first step is to ensure its would-be partner stays in the fight.

Dan Snyder, the embattled owner of the Washington Commanders, hired bankers to explore "potential transactions," the NFL team said.

What's News: Business & Finance
